subtitle: Vitamins keep you in good shape
description: Vitamins keep you in good shape
title: Why do I need vitamins?
content:
Created by BabyCenter


Vitamins are important in your diet, especially when you are pregnant. They help your baby grow well and keep your body in good shape for becoming a mother. 

Eat a variety of fresh food of different colors each day to get vitamins:

•	Eggs, orange colored fruit and vegetables like mangoes and papaya, sweet potato or carrots. These foods contain vitamin A, which helps your baby's organs and body systems to develop.

•	Bananas, potatoes and chicken, brown rice and green vegetables. These foods supply B vitamins to help your body use protein, fats, and carbohydrates (starches). They also help to form new red blood cells and develop the brain and nerves.

•	Citrus fruit like grapefruit, oranges and lime, guavas, kiwi and vegetables like potatoes and tomatoes. These are all good sources of vitamin C, which is needed for repairing and growing skin and body tissue. It also helps growth and strengthens bones and teeth. 

•	Oily fish, like sardines and salmon, cow’s milk, soy milk and eggs. These contain vitamin D, which helps to build bones and teeth and helps you to fight germs. Our bodies can also make vitamin D from sunlight.
